posts.post_content: I like that it offers you a variety of sea monsters, rather than it being restricted to a single tribe. I wish there were more cards that functioned across two or more tribe. Ula's Temple is a portal any sea denizen can use; Lovisa doesn't discriminate between warriors, bersekers, and barbarians who want to help her crush Varchild; Death Baron likes several forms of animated corpses -- these cards just work so well from a flavor perspective.
posts.html:
I like that it offers you a variety of sea monsters, rather than it being restricted to a single tribe. I wish there were more cards that functioned across two or more tribe. Ula's Temple is a portal any sea denizen can use; Lovisa doesn't discriminate between warriors, bersekers, and barbarians who want to help her crush Varchild; Death Baron likes several forms of animated corpses -- these cards just work so well from a flavor perspective.

posts.post_content: I love this card. That said, it's extremely demanding because you need to build your deck around it. A little disenchantment can ruin your day. Halimar Depths and Sage Owl can help. I'd run this with Clone as well since it will help you complete the quest, copy your non-legendary fatties, and basically deal with any creature problem. Spreading seas can give you card draw, help out your island-walk sea-monsters, and give your opponent another enchantment besides Ula's to worry about.
posts.html:

Posted By: BossCrab (2/4/2010 12:36:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A decent card. Its a good combo card for constructed, and its very flavourful, and it lets you get your fatties out for cheap. And you can probably get enough cards in your deck to justify it in sealed. In booster draft, you DO NOT want to open this unless third pack unless you lucked out and ended up with a play set of[Shoal Serpent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shoal Serpent) and [Kraken Hatchling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kraken Hatchling), and maybe a [Lorthos, the Tidemaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lorthos, the Tidemaker). However, just because its not good in draft doesn't mean its still not an amazing card. It just erks me when I open this in a Zendikar-Zendikar-World Wake draft, and it got passed to a guy who opened [Wrexial, the Risen Deep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrexial, the Risen Deep) :-(
posts.html:
A decent card. Its a good combo card for constructed, and its very flavourful, and it lets you get your fatties out for cheap. And you can probably get enough cards in your deck to justify it in sealed. In booster draft, you DO NOT want to open this unless third pack unless you lucked out and ended up with a play set ofShoal Serpent and Kraken Hatchling, and maybe a Lorthos, the Tidemaker. However, just because its not good in draft doesn't mean its still not an amazing card. It just erks me when I open this in a Zendikar-Zendikar-World Wake draft, and it got passed to a guy who opened Wrexial, the Risen Deep :-(

posts.post_content:
do you think there will be more serpents in rise of the eldrazi? maybe another octopus? i know they probably weren't thinking this as seeing much standard play, but as of right now there's only 3 serpents and 1 octopus. i dunno, just food for thought.
  
   
as far as the card goes, i think it has great synergy. as long as you can drop it within the first two turns, it quickly turns into something that an opponent has to deal with soon or the card might get out of hand.

posts.post_content:
Instead of [Sage Owl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sage Owl) run [Augury Owl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augury Owl). Thrummingbird is a good suggestion, I find [Gomazoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gomazoa) helpful and Looters to toss extra copies. Run some reanimation too or [Noxious Revival](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noxious Revival) to help pick up fatties you pitched with the looter. Even [Screeching Silcaw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Screeching Silcaw) could be fun if artifact leviathans are your flavor of choice.  
  
Also, [Thassa, god of the sea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thassa, god of the sea) helps the game along. Theros has provided for this build a bit with her and [Omenspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Omenspeaker).
posts.html:
Instead of Sage Owl run Augury Owl. Thrummingbird is a good suggestion, I find Gomazoa helpful and Looters to toss extra copies. Run some reanimation too or Noxious Revival to help pick up fatties you pitched with the looter. Even Screeching Silcaw could be fun if artifact leviathans are your flavor of choice.

Also, Thassa, god of the sea helps the game along. Theros has provided for this build a bit with her and Omenspeaker.

posts.post_content:
@Arachnos  
Technically, Ula is [Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre)! The three Zendikar deities Ula, Cosi, and Emeria were time-worn and corrupted memories of the first time the Eldrazi came to Zendikar. The denizens of Zendikar before the Eldrazi were set free worshipped these old "gods" much as people from our world worship our deities, and throughout the first two sets in the block you see a lot of references to these mistaken gods.
posts.html:
@Arachnos
Technically, Ula is Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre! The three Zendikar deities Ula, Cosi, and Emeria were time-worn and corrupted memories of the first time the Eldrazi came to Zendikar. The denizens of Zendikar before the Eldrazi were set free worshipped these old "gods" much as people from our world worship our deities, and throughout the first two sets in the block you see a lot of references to these mistaken gods.
